{"abstract": "The interesting thing about entrepreneurship is that you can encounter stress either because you are busy and growing and making money \u2014 or because you are not.", "web_url": "https://boss.blogs.nytimes.com/2009/10/06/six-ways-to-deal-with-small-business-stress/", "snippet": "The interesting thing about entrepreneurship is that you can encounter stress either because you are busy and growing and making money \u2014 or because you are not.", "lead_paragraph": "Even though there are signs that the economy may be starting to turn around, this has been and continues to be a stressful year for most business owners. I often think stress should be spelled $tre$$. I cannot think of many jobs that pay a good amount of money that don\u2019t also offer a good amount of stress. The interesting thing about entrepreneurship is that you can encounter stress either because you are busy and growing and making money \u2014 or because you are not. After many years of ups and downs, I have some tips on how to deal with stress in productive ways:", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Six Ways to Deal With Small-Business Stress", "kicker": "You're the Boss", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [], "pub_date": "2009-10-06T17:03:39+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "Entrepreneurship", "byline": {"original": "By Jay Goltz", "person": [{"firstname": "Jay", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Goltz", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "", "_id": "nyt://article/20497001-7e23-5c23-a118-b3323b547434", "word_count": 612, "uri": "nyt://article/20497001-7e23-5c23-a118-b3323b547434"}

{"abstract": "United Parcel Service will increase ground-shipment rates in 2010 by 4.9 percent, less than this year, as volume drops.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2009/11/21/business/economy/21bizbriefs-UPSSETS49PER_BRF.html", "snippet": "United Parcel Service will increase ground-shipment rates in 2010 by 4.9 percent, less than this year, as volume drops.", "lead_paragraph": "United Parcel Service will increase ground-shipment rates in 2010 by 4.9 percent, less than this year, as volume drops. Average rates for goods sent by air will rise 6.9 percent, with a two percentage point cut in the fuel surcharge on those deliveries, the same as this year, U.P.S. said Friday. Fuel charges during 2010 also will be adjusted more slowly once the changes take effect on Jan. 4, U.P.S. said. The rate increase for U.P.S.\u2019s ground unit is smaller than 5.9 percent increase in 2009, which was the most in at least eight years as the company faced higher costs for labor, health care and pensions. {"abstract": "A hazard of \u201chot money\u201d is that easy-come, easy-go investors will make economies vulnerable to booms and busts.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2010/10/13/business/13views.html", "snippet": "A hazard of \u201chot money\u201d is that easy-come, easy-go investors will make economies vulnerable to booms and busts.", "lead_paragraph": "Hot money (money in pursuit of short-term gains) is the bugbear of policy makers in many developing economies. Ask Brazil or, indeed, Thailand, which just imposed a 15 percent withholding tax on interest and capital gains earned by foreign investors on Thai bonds. {"abstract": "The Business Council for Peace is a nonprofit network of professionals who provide pro bono business services to entrepreneurs in countries with conflicts \u2014 Rwanda and Afghanistan, so far.", "web_url": "https://boss.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/04/28/helping-small-businesses-that-really-know-about-ups-and-downs/", "snippet": "The Business Council for Peace is a nonprofit network of professionals who provide pro bono business services to entrepreneurs in countries with conflicts \u2014 Rwanda and Afghanistan, so far.", "lead_paragraph": "This month, a group of Rwandan female entrepreneurs traveled to the United States to learn from their American counterparts. The women, survivors of the 1994 genocide, were graduates of a three-year program created by the Business Council for Peace, a nonprofit network of professionals who provide pro bono business services to entrepreneurs in countries with conflicts\u00a0 \u2014 Rwanda and Afghanistan, so far, and El Salvador soon. The organization, known as BPeace, was built on the beliefs that more jobs mean less violence and that entrepreneurs are best positioned to create employment opportunities.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Helping Small Businesses That Really Know About Ups and Downs", "kicker": "You're the Boss", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Entrepreneurship", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Women and Girls", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "glocations", "value": "AFGHANISTAN", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "glocations", "value": "El Salvador", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "glocations", "value": "Rwanda", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2011-04-28T11:00:44+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "Entrepreneurship", "byline": {"original": "By Adriana Gardella", "person": [{"firstname": "Adriana", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Gardella", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "", "_id": "nyt://article/2576a364-ab54-5106-926d-152e1819e35d", "word_count": 499, "uri": "nyt://article/2576a364-ab54-5106-926d-152e1819e35d"}

{"abstract": "The chief executive of Discovery Communications told advertisers on Wednesday that the Hispanic market promises significant growth when compared to mainstream cable channels.", "web_url": "https://mediadecoder.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/05/18/upfronts-discovery-ups-the-stakes-in-hispanic-media/", "snippet": "The chief executive of Discovery Communications told advertisers on Wednesday that the Hispanic market promises significant growth when compared to mainstream cable channels.", "lead_paragraph": "To underscore the priority that Discovery Communications says it is placing on Hispanic viewers, the president and chief executive, David Zaslav, made a herculean effort to attend the Discovery U.S. Hispanic upfront presentation at the Four Seasons restaurant in Midtown Manhattan on Wednesday.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Upfronts: Discovery Ups the Stakes in Hispanic Media", "kicker": "Media Decoder", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Television", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Zaslav, David", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Discovery Channel", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2011-05-18T16:06:31+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "Media", "byline": {"original": "By Stuart Elliott", "person": [{"firstname": "Stuart", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Elliott", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "", "_id": "nyt://article/a162dc13-5056-57be-b894-1e8fc63998ed", "word_count": 405, "uri": "nyt://article/a162dc13-5056-57be-b894-1e8fc63998ed"}

{"abstract": "Managed futures funds, which have found success in the financial crisis by betting on the ups and downs of everyone else, have finally hit their own slump.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2011/07/14/sluggish-market-stalls-funds-that-thrive-on-direction/", "snippet": "Managed futures funds, which have found success in the financial crisis by betting on the ups and downs of everyone else, have finally hit their own slump.", "lead_paragraph": "Managed futures funds, which bet on the ups and downs of stocks, bonds, commodities and currencies, have been crowing for years about their performance during the financial crisis.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Sluggish Market Stalls Funds That Thrive on Direction", "kicker": "DealBook", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Commodities", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Hedge Funds", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Asness, Clifford Scott", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Man Group", "rank": 6, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2011-07-15T00:30:16+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Azam Ahmed", "person": [{"firstname": "Azam", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Ahmed", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/1988fde2-0efb-5aa8-adef-535102f78167", "word_count": 816, "uri": "nyt://article/1988fde2-0efb-5aa8-adef-535102f78167"}

{"abstract": "Company boards are attracted to share buybacks when markets are down, but the purchase often ends up damaging the value of a stock.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2011/08/25/business/the-negative-side-of-share-buybacks-reuters-breakingviews.html", "snippet": "Company boards are attracted to share buybacks when markets are down, but the purchase often ends up damaging the value of a stock.", "lead_paragraph": "Share buybacks are creeping back into fashion. {"abstract": "Dell has spent more on share repurchases than it earned throughout its life as a public company, and most of those repurchases were at prices well above current levels.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2013/01/18/business/how-dell-became-entangled-in-options.html", "snippet": "Dell has spent more on share repurchases than it earned throughout its life as a public company, and most of those repurchases were at prices well above current levels.", "lead_paragraph": "It was an amazing American success story, in which a college student in his dorm room created what became one of the largest computer companies in the world. In the 1990s, its share price tripled in each of three consecutive years. {"abstract": "After five years, this is the final post on You\u2019re the Boss. As a parting gift, we offer some highlights from another year spent in the trenches, where we all continued to make mistakes and learn lessons.", "web_url": "https://boss.blogs.nytimes.com/2014/12/23/so-long-from-youre-the-boss/", "snippet": "After five years, this is the final post on You\u2019re the Boss. As a parting gift, we offer some highlights from another year spent in the trenches, where we all continued to make mistakes and learn lessons.", "lead_paragraph": "For the past five years, it\u2019s been my pleasure to edit the You\u2019re the Boss small-business blog, which has afforded me the opportunity to work with a talented array of journalists and business owners. The journalists covered their beats diligently, the owners shared their ups and downs generously, and we all benefited from the comments offered by an exceedingly smart group of readers.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "So Long, From You\u2019re the Boss", "kicker": "You're the Boss", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Small Business", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2014-12-23T12:00:59+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "Entrepreneurship", "byline": {"original": "By Loren Feldman", "person": [{"firstname": "Loren", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Feldman", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/9702c6b3-05e1-507f-8b97-fc89801f1b59", "word_count": 350, "uri": "nyt://article/9702c6b3-05e1-507f-8b97-fc89801f1b59"}

{"abstract": "The housing market in much of the nation seems to be in a Goldilocks moment, neither too hot nor too cold, with low mortgage rates an added bonus.", "web_url":
